II. ALLEGATION(S)
Violation
Established?
Staff asked resident to undress without reason, which resident did
not comply, and on another occasion the same staff stared at the No

III. METHODOLOGY
08/15/2019 Special Investigation Intake
2019C0219045

ALLEGATION: Staff asked resident to undress without reason, which resident did
not comply, and on another occasion the same staff stared at the resident while in
his room.
INVESTIGATION:
Centralized intake date 08/15/2019 was reviewed. Approximately seven weeks ago
staff person 1 repeatedly instructed resident A to undress without telling him why.
Another resident is believed to have heard the incident as well. Resident A refused
to follow staff person 1’s instruction. During the same time staff person allegedly
stood outside resident A’s bedroom door and stared at him. No physical contact is
reported. Resident A states another resident is throwing feces which staff does not
do anything about.
2

Resident A’s written statement dated 08/13/2019 was reviewed. It states staff
person 1 came to his room after shower time and asked him to undress. He
questioned why he needed to undress at which time staff person 1 walked away. A
couple minutes later staff person 1 came back and again asked for resident A to
undress approximately eight times. The next day, resident B asked resident A why
staff person 1 asked for him to take off his clothes stating that he indicated that he
did not know.
It is noted that resident A is transgendered and prefers to be addressed by a female
name. In addition, resident C referenced resident A as “she/her” during the interview
process. For the purpose of this investigation report resident A shall be referenced
as “he/him” as the facility is licensed for males only.
Resident A was interviewed onsite on 08/22/2019. His written statement was read
to him which he states is an accurate account of events. Resident A states he is
transgendered and previously ripped up his clothing to fashion them into crop tops
when he was first placed at the facility in 05/2019. He states that he stopped such
practice due to the negative attention he was receiving from other residents. He
states being inside his bedroom one evening with the door close when staff person 1
approached. Resident A states wearing a white t-shirt and shorts with a blanket
wrapped around him when staff person 1 asked him to get naked. Resident A
clarified that staff person 1 asked for him to “undress” which he assumed meant to
get naked. Resident A states he did not comply with staff person 1’s directives and
further states staff person 1 did not ask him to take off the blanket. Resident A
states no other residents were present though states resident B reported the next
day that he overheard their conversation from within his own bedroom. Resident A
also reports staff person 1 exclaiming to him one time with no one around, “If I were
to ask for a blow job would that make me gay?” It is noted that resident A did not
indicate any other issues with staff person 1 regarding him “staring at him” one time
as he alleges.
Resident B’s written statement dated 08/14/2019 was reviewed. It states everyone
were in their bedrooms except for resident C and staff person’s 1 and 2 being on the
pod. Resident C was refusing to “step down” and notes that resident C and resident
A were “Supposed to be in a relationship”. Resident C kept going to resident A’s
door and that he informed staff that they were not supposed to be talking. Staff
person 1 approached and asked resident A “What you got on? You don’t got no
shorts on, move your shorts over take your shorts, take that cover off, let me see
you dance, etc.”
Resident B was interviewed onsite on 08/22/2019. His written statement was read
to him which he states is an accurate account of events. He states his bedroom is in
the corner near resident A’s bedroom though cannot see inside the room. He recalls
resident A being on the bed during a conversation with staff person 1 noting the door
was closed and that resident C was present as well. Resident B states hearing staff
3

person 1 ask resident A what he was wearing and reiterated the information noted in
his written statement.
Resident C was interviewed onsite on 08/28/2019. He states remembering a night
when resident A called him over to his door, which resident C complied. Resident C
states resident A was wearing a blanket and assumed he was naked under the
blanket though could confirm. Resident C states he walked away from resident A’s
door when staff person 1 approached. He states staff person 1 exclaimed, “You
don’t got clothes on do you?” and recalls hearing resident A laughing and then both
laughing. It is noted that resident C presented as defensive throughout the interview
and was observed trying to read this writer’s notes and frequently questioned
whether he was in trouble, which he was reassured that he was not. Resident C
then asked whether someone called PREA on him, which he was again reassured
that no one had.
Staff person 1 was interviewed in person on 08/28/2019. He reports being a
contingent staff at the facility for six years noting that he is not assigned to one
specific pod and is aware of PREA. The allegations were read to him as he did not
recall anything out of the ordinary while on pod A approximately two months ago.
He recalls resident C standing at resident A’s door and repeatedly walking back and
forth to resident A’s bedroom door and peering in window. Staff person 1 states
questioning resident C as to why he was standing at resident A’s door and
repeatedly asked for him to step-down. He states resident C eventually walked
away and that staff person 1 approached and stood at resident A’s door and asked
him what resident C was doing at the door. Staff person 1 states resident A was
wearing orange shorts and a t-shirt and a blanket as well. Staff person 1 denies
asking resident A to disrobe and states he was attempting to figure out what resident
A and C were doing through the bedroom door window. Staff person 1 also denies
discussing anything regarding fellatio or being gay with resident A.
Therapist was interviewed via telephone on 08/28/2019. She reports being aware of
the allegations involving resident A and staff person 1. She was not aware that
resident C was present during the time of resident A’s allegations toward staff
person 1. This writer asked if resident A and C are in/have had a relationship, per
resident B’s statement that the two were previously. Therapist states resident A
allegedly performed oral sex on resident C one time and masturbation over clothing
on another occasion. The oral sex incident occurred when a staff person took
residents A, C, and another resident to make phone calls, whereas the other incident
occurred on the pod. Therapist states administration was made aware of the
incident and it was investigated.
Incident report dated 06/26/2019 was reviewed. It states resident’s A and C were
observed continually fondling each other under the pod table. Once redirected to
separate from each other, it was observed that resident C had an erection.
Appropriate disciplinary measures have been taken.
4

Resident A was again interviewed on 08/29/2019. He was questioned about the
06/26/2019 incident involving him and resident C. He states resident C wanted him
to do it (fondle him) and that he did it over his clothing. He states staff person 2 was
on the pod and intervened when she observed what was occurring under the table.
Resident A was also questioned about him admitting to giving resident A oral sex.
Resident A states the incident occurred prior to the 06/26/2019 incident and within
the visitation area during phone calls. Resident A reports he, and resident’s C and D
were transported to the visitation area for phone calls by staff person 3. Staff person
3 entered one visitation room with resident D to make his phone call, whereas
resident C and D were placed in another visitation room across the hall. Resident A
states the room, this writer and he were sitting in for this interview, was the same
room he and resident C were placed in. He also states the room across the hall was
the visitation room used for the phone calls. It is noted that both rooms have
windows in which you can observe inside each room from across the hallway though
full access of each room could not be observed. Resident A state’s staff person 4
walked through the visitation area and then exited the area at which point he began
performing oral sex on resident C. He states hearing a door open at which point he
stopped. He states staff person 4 walked by the room and left the visitation area at
which point he started performing oral sex on resident C again. He then states that
he stopped again when he heard staff person 3 exit the visitation room with resident
D and enter the room that he and resident C were in. Resident A states staff person
3 asked what residents A and C were doing and that he informed her that he had
just performed oral sex on resident C. It is noted that resident A repeatedly stated
that staff person 3 did not report the incident. Resident A then indicated that he was
going to inform the judge at his next court hearing of his allegations regarding staff
person 1 asking him to disrobe and that his current placement is not the best
placement for him and wants to be moved.
Resident C was again interviewed on 08/29/2019. It is noted that resident C
exclaimed “Oh, no. Not more” when he saw this interviewer again. Resident C was
questioned about the 06/26/2019 incident involving he and resident A. He states
resident A “grabbed my stuff” from under the table and that he continued to grab for
approximately one to two minutes. Resident C states staff were present and that he
told resident A to stop. Resident C was also questioned about an alleged incident
inside the visitation area involving he and resident A. Resident C states, “She said
she sucked my (expletive).” Resident C denies the incident as occurring though
states “they (the pod) said she did it”, as well as staff person 3. Resident C
repeatedly denied the allegations of oral sex occurring and adamantly exclaimed
that there are no cameras in the visitation area. Resident C reports sitting in the
visitation room in front of the window and that he had visual contact of staff person 3
during the entire time of resident D’s phone call. Resident C does not recall
observing any security personnel or other staff being present other than staff person
3 in the other visitation room. Resident C ended the interview by continually asking
whether this writer was lying that he was not in any trouble.
5

Former staff person 3 was interviewed via telephone on 08/31/2019. She states
bringing residents A, C and D to the visitation area for phone calls. She reports her
and resident D being in the visitation room closest to the control room and has a
room next to it with a window that spans the distance of the connecting wall starting
at approximately four feet from the floor. She reports residents A and C were placed
in the room across the hall that has a window across from where her room was
located. She states being able to directly observe resident C sitting in front of the
window though could not see resident A as he was sitting in a chair where the wall
began. After resident D’s phone-call she went into the visitation room where
resident A and C were located and did not observe anything out of the ordinary. She
states resident A did not inform her of any inappropriate sexual interactions
occurring while she was in the other room with resident D as he reports. She reports
facility management implemented a process in which any additional residents during
phone calls be placed in the adjoining, entire windowed, room only.
Staff person 4 was interviewed via telephone on 08/31/2019. He does not report
being made aware of any allegations involving residents A and C in the visitation
area. He states room 1 is where phone calls are to occur and the room next door
that shares a window should be where any additional residents are to be placed as
to maintain constant visual supervision of them. He states residents should not be
placed in the room across the hall. He reports making rounds through the visitation
area though is not required to provide direct visual supervision of residents as the
staff person accompanying the residents are to supervise.
Director was interviewed on 08/28/2019. He reports resident A making allegations
regarding him performing oral sex on resident C after the 06/26/2019 incident
involving him grabbing resident C on the pod. He reports an internal investigation
occurred and the facility determined the allegations to be unfounded. He further
states staff person 3 did not report any inappropriate behaviors occurring or being
informed of any inappropriate behaviors occurring after the phone calls.
Staff persons 2 was not interviewed she terminated her employment with the facility
prior to the onset of this investigation.
The facility is aware of the allegations regarding a resident who throws feces and is
being addressed with clinical staff.
6

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4112 Staff qualifications.
(1) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
ANALYSIS: There is no conclusive evidence to suggest that staff instructed
resident A to get naked. Resident A is transgendered with a
history of fashioning female undergarments with facility supplied
clothing. Approximately two months ago, resident C repeatedly
approached resident A’s bedroom door and interacted with him
through his closed bedroom door. Resident C assumed
resident A was naked under his blanket though could not
confirm. Staff person 1 redirected resident C from resident A’s
door-window and questioned resident A what was happening. It
is noted that resident’s A and C previously engaged in sexually
inappropriate behaviors which occurred around the same time
period as resident A’s allegations.
There is further no conclusive evidence to suggest staff person
1 of inappropriate sexual dialogue occurring as resident A
alleges.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
7

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these
administrative rules and in the agency's program statement and
to provide for the continual needs, protection, and supervision of
residents.
ANALYSIS: The facility did not provide for adequate supervision of
residents. Staff brought three residents into the visitation area
for phone calls. Staff person 3 placed two residents inside of
one visitation room, whereas she and the third resident were in
a separate room across the hall. Windows are noted in both
visitation rooms, but the entire rooms cannot be viewed. Staff
report being able to directly observe resident C through the
window, but not resident A as he was sitting in a chair where the
wall blocked her visual line of sight. Security personnel walked
through the visitation area but did not maintain constant visual
contact with residents A and C as that was staff person 3’s
responsibility.
It cannot be conclusively determined whether resident A and C
engaged in inappropriate sexual contact while in the visitation
room. Resident A states he gave oral sex to resident C,
whereas resident C denies such an incident as occurring. Such
contact appears probable given their 06/26/2019 confirmed
incident of fondling and because staff person 3 could not directly
observe resident A as he was initially seated behind a wall and
out of her view. It is noted that the facility implemented
unwritten procedures in which additional residents be placed
only in the adjourning visitation room with full window, rather
than any other visitation rooms in which constant visual contact
cannot be maintained.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
8

No change to the current license is recommended.
